name: Dresser Palmer House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: our stay at the dresser palmer was a great experience ...loved every moment there.and the city was very fun..
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: My trip down south was a budget trip but I knew in Savannah I wanted to stay at a nice place. So I read some reviews on the Dresser Palmer House and booked it for 2 days. It was the best money I spent on this trip.
reviews.title: Best money I spent..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not only is the house beautiful, elegant and peaceful but the hospitality and customer service I received from the house staff was beyond extraordinary. They were knowledgeable about the best tours, the best restaurants etc., they went out of their way to make last minute ghost tour reservations for me and they did it all with a smile.
reviews.title: Such a Lovely Wonderful Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This B&B is in a lovely old home on a gorgeous street in the perfect location for touring the historical district of Savannah. It is located about 1/2 mile from the Davenport House and less than a mile from the Riverfront. The walk through the historical area, down Bull Street and through the famous Savannah Squares, is just lovely.
reviews.title: Comfy and quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B&B is beautiful and beautifully furnished. The gardens are lovely. There is a wide long porch on the front of the home with comfy rattan rockers and the back of the home has a large cool covered patio with tables and chairs.
reviews.title: What a wonderful B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short, some large issues (which possibly have some mitigants) Summary below and more lengthy description thereafter.
reviews.title: Very Dissapointing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room - Large, old furniture. Everything looks worn, sheets are terrible, have pilling (sp?) on them and just plain cheap. Bathroom is redone and looks new, but we could barely use it since it was so cold in our room.
reviews.title: Excellent accomodations and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service - terrible. Rude, unhelpful staff. I think unfortunately since this isn't an owner run B&B the service here really suffers, especially compared to other B&B's in that area. When we were leaving the manager of the property did not even apologize for the fact that our room was not heated, and that we had to spend a night in that room.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food - also not good, sorry. Oily and runny and uninteresting.
reviews.title: Staying here really created a wonderful Savannah experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010
reviews.text: I will say that my review of the room itself may have been different if it was really warm when we were in Savannah. There were large walk out windows in our room and a patio where you could sit. However given our weather (and snow!) we were just freezing.
reviews.title: Loved it, can't wait to go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The house and porch were very nice. We stayed in the Wisteria partially because the room, fireplace, and big jacuzzi tub appealed to us, but also because it was only 1 of 2 where we had our own thermostat we could control. Another plus is that it had 2 private entrances (one front, one back). The room was very inviting looking, but there was a bit of a smell that one might expect staying in a basement room. I could look past that if it weren't for the bottom sheet itching me. The itchy sheet was not comfortable. Hopefully it wasn't the sheet, but I did wake up with a small red splotch on my face and it appeared my husband had the same on his lower back. This might have nothing to do with the room. It could be the water or different weather etc., but I thought it was worth mentioning since we stayed elsewhere for the rest of the stay and the red splotches were gone the next day.
reviews.title: Nice, but not too impressed

likes.liked: — It was very attractive and I love big porches
likes.disliked: — Not as warm and welcoming as one might expect and not a good breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: On a nicer note, the room was cozy and is as it appears in pics. The wine and cheese were great, but people didn't socialize much.
reviews.title: Lovely house and excellent concierge service

likes.disliked: — the air conditioner in our room did not always keep it really cool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was not nearly as good as expected from a high price inn. We had egg and vegetable casserole...if that doesn't sound unappealing enough, it had almost no flavor. The muffins weren't even very good. There was no other option like pancakes, waffles etc.. We were disappointed. The other disappointment was that the place did not have a real warm and inviting feel to it. No one was rude, but, aside from Dave, no one was all that friendly or eager to give us info on the city.
reviews.title: FANTASTIC WEEKEND!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our intent on staying at a b & b or inn for the first night was due to reviews of how the host or hostess gives one a bunch of good information. I guess our experience was more like a hotel. Although less than expected, it was overall a pretty good place to stay. I would not return there though. If you are willing to skip the B&B or Inn experience, I highly rec. Armstrong Inns, where you get your own house for just about the same price.
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A friend and I visited Savannah for 4 nights in mid-October and really enjoyed staying at the PDH. The concierge service is outstanding and was so helpful in making reservations at restaurants and a trolley tour, recommending a day spa, arranging for taxis and pedicabs, and giving us directions, etc. for a day trip out to Tybee Island. One of the nicest things offered by the PDH is a 5:30pm social hour with wine and cheese and crackers. It was nice to come back from a day of touring around the city and relax by the fire in the living room or in one of the rocking chairs on the front porch. Staying at PDH really made our time in Savannah shine.
reviews.title: The Wedding of Our Dreams

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009
reviews.text: My daughter and her husband booked the entire Dresser-Palmer House in April for their wedding guests. As a professional couple they wanted a quiet, warm atmosphere for friends and family from all over North America to gather and reconnect. Each room's decor is different, and features period furnishings; everything is comfortable and immaculate. Recent renovations including modern Italian marble bathrooms are luxurious. The front porch with its rocking chairs, the wisteria canopied back porch, the dining room and the front parlor were great for visiting and relaxing. The gourmet breakfast and the wine and cheese buffet are artistically presented AND very tasty. The staff is always available, kind, and capable; they not only met our needs, they anticipated them. This is quiet and genteel, secluded from the touristy hubbub, but close to everything-- the very best of old Savannah. We will be visiting again.
reviews.title: Elegant, quiet, beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008
reviews.text: Great place--my mother and I stayed for two nights. It was quiet, at the edge of the historic district, and wonderfully homey. Lovely garden, inviting wine and cheese service, scrumptious breakfast, comfy front porch, friendly staff, convenient 24 hour gourmet tea and coffee, and a fireplace to ward off the winter chill. They were going to close for remodeling right after we left, so it's probably even better now!
reviews.title: Wonderful quiet stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can't stop raving about our stay at the Dresser Palmer House. It was warm and inviting, beautifully decorated, and was in a great location.
reviews.title: An Unforgettable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room, recommended by Ron, far exceeded our expectations. The fireplace and the veranda were spectacular. Everyone at the Inn was so friendly and accommodating. We enjoyed chatting with other guests over wine and cheese our first evening in town, and the next afternoon, we were married in a tiny ceremony in the Inn's courtyard.
reviews.title: Loved the Dresser Palmer House - Loved Savannah!

likes.liked: — The house was beautiful, the room very comfortable and we loved the Jacuzzi for two

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Ron saw to every detail and helped us to have the wedding of our dreams. We can't wait to come back and visit the Dresser Palmer House again.
reviews.title: AS good as all the reviews..

likes.liked: — Concerige service, decor, and overall southern ambience

description: Ideally located within the nation’s largest urban Historic Landmark District, Dresser Palmer House, a historic Savannah bed and breakfast, offers an elegant southern vacation setting with quaint hospitality to delight the most discriminating traveler. Come stay at one of Savannah’s oldest and most exclusive locations, one block from world famous Forsyth Park.Built in 1876 by Henry Dresser and Samuel Palmer, this 11,000 square foot Italianate townhouse now operates as one of Savannah’s finest bed and breakfast inns, providing a variety of distinctive accommodations from king canopy beds and private baths to our ADA compliant lift and guest suite.At the Dresser Palmer House bed and breakfast in Savannah, you will find amenities normally seen in much larger hotels, coupled with the personal attention found only in the very best inns. We invite you to come and experience true southern hospitality at its finest.
